tweet: Today, we took a stand for the rule of law. We took a stand to uphold our Constitution. And we took action to uphold our oaths of office. I did not cast my vote for an impeachment investigation lightly, but I am proud to have done my duty.

We’ve received disturbing reports that immigrants detained by the Department of Homeland Security in our community are being denied access to flu shots. This is a failure to provide safe and sanitary conditions, as required by law. Lives are at risk. This policy must end.

The House’s vote today will ensure transparency and consistency as our impeachment investigation moves into a new phase. We have gathered crucial evidence in a fair process, but the American people need to see the facts.

The president’s transcript of his call with Ukrainian President Zelensky showed a quid pro quo to demand an investigation. Lt. Col. Vindman is alleging that the White House may be concealing even more damning evidence from the call. We need answers now. https://nyti.ms/32TnKet

The facts are clear. The president’s attempts to force a foreign government to interfere in our elections are unacceptable and impeachable. Many of my GOP colleagues can recognize how dangerous and wrong his conduct was. They need to join us and hold him accountable.
